meanings.definition: relating to the study of the structure of metals
meanings.sent1: The metallographically analysis helped identify the composition of the alloy.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used metallographically techniques to examine the steel sample.
meanings.sent3: The metallographically detailed report on the metal's properties was surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the metallographically intricate patterns on the surface of the steel.
meanings.sent5: The students were amazed by the metallographically clear images of the metal's structure.

meanings.definition: in a manner related to the examination of metal structures through microscopy
meanings.sent1: She observed the metallographically prepared sample under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The technician examined the metallographically polished surface with precision.
meanings.sent3: The microscope revealed a metallographically tiny world within the metal sample.
meanings.sent4: The details were so small, they seemed to exist in a metallographically different dimension.
meanings.sent5: The metallographically analyzed image showed the intricate details of the metal's structure.
